alert.note: Alert for Bell; Breathitt; Clay; Knox; Laurel; Leslie; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 7:40PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, northeastern Bell, northeastern Knox, southeastern Owsley, Leslie, Perry, southwestern Knott, southwestern Breathitt and Clay Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 740 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Wolf Coal to London-Corbin Airport. Movement was southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lamont, Barwick, Chavies, Altro, Wolf Coal, Bush Branch, Krypton, Gays Creek, Beech and Mosley Bend around 745 PM EDT. Dice, Lake and Bush around 750 PM EDT. Hazard, Cranes Nest, Fletcher, Bulan, Fount, Sprule, Green Road, Tedders, Jarvis and Haven around 755 PM EDT. Ritchie, Elic, Cordia, Anco, Hinkle, Ogle and Jeff around 800 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Vicco, Amburgey, Scalf, Salt Gum, Hammond, Smithsboro, Barnyard, Carr Creek, Cody, Walker, Bath, Field, Spider, Erose, Littcarr, Mills, Redfox, Dirk, Ashers Fork, Skidmore, Beverly, Sandy Fork and Gardner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Breathitt; Clay; Knox; Laurel; Leslie; Owsley
